We were thinking of putting

I was in Tanzania,
but their water supply

dries up a few
months a year, which

meant that just to get
water for their family,

they would have to
either pay more or walk
a really far distance.

So something like this,
would be a lower priority.

And there's a good
chance that it
would dry up and stop working.

And after that, it's really
hard to get it going again.

So the three things
that are really

important for a biogas system
are a good supply of manure,

having a hot enough
temperature, and having
a good supply of water.

So if you have
those three things
it's a really good solution.

But if one is missing,
then it will be tricky.

REBECCA SMITH: So one thing
that you can do with the heat
sealer, is make a soda stack.

So this is used for solar
disinfection of water.

So it's one way that
you can purify water.

What you do, is
you can fill any,

basically, clear plastic
container with water.

And then you leave it out in the
sun for about six hours or so.

And it will kill the
bacteria that's in it.

So you might still need to
filter it if it's turbid.

But as one step, that's
actually pretty effective.

So actually a D-lab alum,
MIT alum, called Sean Frayne,

his company is
called [? Haddock ?]
and they produce these.

So an alternative would be to
just fill maybe a plastic water
bottle, or this is one.

But it uses more
material than this so
would be more expensive.

And it's not super easy to
fill if you're pouring water
from something.

So what he came up
with, is just this bag.

Basically, you can
fill the water here.
So it'll just go in

And then, so basically,

And this is something that

Amy brings a heat sealer

Because there are just
a lot of useful things
that you can make.

I worked on a pouring dispenser
for my D-lab design project.

And we did something
kind of like this,

where it's like this, but
it's just a one-way valve.

So the idea isn't that you'll be
able to get it out afterwards.

But this was a really
low-cost way for us

to store the chlorine,
and then keep people
from getting it out.

Because we didn't want anyone
to be able to siphon it out
or tamper or anything like that.
Another thing you can do.

So this is a drip
irrigation kit.

And the way this works, is you
would fill it up with water,

and then you'd have
a tube coming out.

And from that tube,
are many little straws.

And you can direct a
small amount of water
straight to your crops.

So it's a much more
effective way of irrigating.
And it uses a lot less water.

And someone who I've
worked with in Tanzania,

named Bernard, he
has actually made

his own heat-sealing
machines, like this.

And so he can make
the tubes that

would come out of this,
just from a heat sealer

and locally available
plastic rather than having
to buy that or import it.

Another thing you can do to
seal something like this,

if you have male and
female pieces like this,

you can take some rubber
and make a washer.

And what you do is, have
a rubber washer layer
then a plastic or metal washer.

And then you could
have your plastic bag.

Basically, this
piece is a way to--

and then on the
other side, you'd

have another rubber
washer, plastic washer.

And then you could have a
sealed connection there.

Just as an example of
something else you could do.

A way to connect a bag like
this to something else.

So the things we have
that you can try out.

So you can adjust the
